section.title: Module
section.para: Just as the is the beneficiary's view of the Letter of Credit, this (SR) module is the beneficiary's view of the Standby LC.

Whereas the module is for use by the applicant, this module provides the beneficiary with a notification of the terms issued in his favour, and a way to send further transactional messages to his advising banks on those records.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This module enables you, on behalf of your company (the beneficiary), to receive notification of Standby Letters of Credit, and subsequent amendments or updates, from the Advising Bank. You can also send messages back to the bank for events that require your approval in the ongoing transaction flow, or to initiate a transfer.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: As the primary beneficiary, transfer in full or partially a Standby Letter of Credit to a second beneficiary.
Send a free-format message to the Issuing Bank.
View all existing SRs, that are not yet complete.
Display lists of existing SRs, according to specific search criteria.
Maintain Unsigned, Purged and Rejected SRs

section.condition: TITLE=Received Standby Export Letter of Credit - Transfer;PERM=sr_transfer;ACCESS=SR_TRANS
section.title: SR Transfer & Assignment
section.para: This section describes the Transfer and Assignment part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: Transfer Functions
section.para: This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to initiate a transfer of a Received Standby Letter of Credit.

listitem.para: Transfer part of an existing Received Standby Letter of Credit to a second beneficiary. Only available if the original Received Standby Letter of Credit is transferable.

This can only be done for a Received Standby Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Received Standby Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable.
The second beneficiary is guaranteed to receive payment provided he satisfies the terms laid down in the transfer credit, irrespective of the actions of your own company, the main beneficiary.
This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the transfer.
Assign part of the proceeds that you expect to receive under an existing Standby Letter of Credit to a second beneficiary.

This can only be done for a Standby Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, this function displays a list of such existing Standby Letters of Credit that have not been not purged and are transferable.
The second beneficiary is only paid when your company, the main beneficiary, receives funds under the Standby Letter of Credit. .
This action sends a message to the Advising Bank, telling them of the assignment.
Review, complete and submit SR records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit SR records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

section.title: Message to Bank
section.para: This section describes the Message to Bank part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: Message to Bank Functions
section.para: This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to send a free-format message to the Advising Bank.

Typical uses are to reply to notification of discrepancies on your documents presented to the Advising Bank, or to indicate that you accept an amendment to the terms of the underlying SR initiated by the applicant.

listitem.para: Create a message from an existing Received Standby Letter of Credit.

This can only be done for an Received Standby Letter of Credit that your company (the main beneficiary) has received notification of from the Advising Bank. Therefore, when you select this option, you are presented with a list of such existing Received Standby Letters of Credit.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
Displays any pending action required to complete the forms.
Review, complete and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have already created and saved, but not submitted.
Review and submit Message to Bank records that you or another user have created, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, System ID, or Applicant fields.
To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: SR Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain SR records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: SR Maintenance - Options
section.para: The following options are available for SR Maintenance:

listitem.para: Set and associate an entity to SR transactions.
Associate a reference to SR transactions.
List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) SR transactions.
List and optionally delete SR transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Bank's Trade Services team.
List and optionally delete rejected transactions.

section.title: SR Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: List all SRs and associate an Entity. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click Set Entity and then select System ID. You can now set an entity for the SR by clicking the search icon
from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: SR Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a SR record that currently has none.
When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference to the record.

note.para: This action is not validated against the Jurisdiction matrix. All transactions of the current files are updated.

section.title: SR Maintenance - Unsigned SRs
section.para: List and optionally delete SR transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: SR Maintenance - Purged SRs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of SR records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
